post.content:
In 1 Kings 11:4, did Solomon fall back into sin at the end of his life?

Solomon made two very important mistakes in his life.

The first was that he ignored God’s instruction not to amass horses for himself, in other words, not to build up his military forces, because that would show a lack of trust in Jehovah’s saving power, and the second, which had far worse consequences, was that he ignored God’s instruction not to take foreign wives. (Deuteronomy 17:16; 1 Kings 11:1–8)

He ignored that second instruction so completely and spectacularly that he ended up with what was doubtless the world’s finest ever poon collection, thousands of wives and concubines. And what happened? As he got older, his wives basically nagged him into apostasy, that is, into serving their false pagan gods.

This, but times 1000.

Needless to say, Jehovah was not impressed. (1 Kings 11:9–13)

Solomon is a good example for us that even the person faithful in least is faithful in much, and the person unfaithful in what is least will likely be unfaithful in much. (Luke 16:10)
post.author: sam

post.content:
What are some of the most awesome psychological facts?

  1. Did you know that 80% of individuals have a strong urge to write their names when given a brand-new pen? It's an interesting little quirk that says a lot about our innate desire for personal expression.
  2. It's said that laughter is the best medicine, but did you know it can also be a sign of loneliness? If someone is laughing at even the lowest quality joke, it may be because they're seeking any kind of connection they can find.
  3. The human body holds many secrets, and one of them lies in our toes. Specifically, the big toe can indicate a hidden nervous weakness, suggesting a desire to blend into the background and avoid drawing attention to oneself.
  5. Have you ever heard the saying that first impressions are everything? Well, it turns out that when we meet someone new, our minds make snap judgments about them within the first 6 seconds of interaction. That's the power of psychology in action.
  6. The way we react to a situation can have a profound impact on the outcome, whether we realize it or not. By controlling our responses and choosing to approach things with positivity, we have the power to radically transform our circumstances.
  7. Sometimes, the things people don't say can speak volumes. When someone seems indifferent or aloof, it may actually be a sign of deep care and concern that they don't feel comfortable expressing openly.
  8. Have you ever heard of the power of writing down negative thoughts and then throwing them away? It may sound silly, but studies have shown that this simple act can actually boost our mood and improve our overall mental health.
  9. We often think of good handwriting as a sign of intelligence and attention to detail, but did you know that bad handwriting can actually be a sign of creativity? In fact, studies have found that people with messy handwriting are often more innovative and original than those with neater script.
  10. When it comes to managing anxiety, sometimes the simplest solutions are the most effective. Eating an orange before work has been shown to reduce anxiety levels, making it a great way to start the day off on the right foot.
  11. When we share our goals with others, we can inadvertently undermine our own success. That's because our brains can interpret talking about our goals as equivalent to actually achieving them, leading to a sense of complacency and reduced motivation.
  12. The natural world has a powerful impact on our minds and bodies, including boosting our cognitive abilities.
post.author: The Don

post.content:
What is the biggest lesson you learned that no one teaches?

  1. Sometimes you need someone to hurt you deep enough to let you know that you were with the wrong one. Learn and move on.
  2. You can be replaced at any time therefore you should watch your back and know when you are ready to move on
  4. If you don't learn from your mistakes, you will end up learning your mistakes and that is something even more complicated.
  5. Good times are good memories and bad times are good lessons. Both times help us in some way.
  6. Some situations require silence even if you have or know an answer.
  7. Don't live with the attitude "I can not do everything" because it will prevent you from doing what you can
  8. Forcing things doesn't make them happen faster. Things happen at the right time for the right reason.
  9. Never reveal your feelings to someone who hides theirs
